Description: Terracotta: coarse ware basket vessel. A pot with a basket-handle, modelled as a floral group: below a heavily moulded rim, are elements of a wreath, including, on both sides, two large bulbous objects that may possibly represent the ivy berries often found on wreaths, below which is a group of small berries or perhaps grapes, and on each side the tips of vine leaves. Two-piece mould with an applied handle over the mouth. Brown Nile silt with some mica and a red core; much of the surface has fired a buff colour. A very few traces of an overall white dressing survive.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3654)
Condition: There are areas of minor damage.
